title: Did Sudden Impact just get gutted because of Irelia?
body:
> Sudden Impact (D2)
> Cooldown increased from 4s to 25s

That's crazy. This rune will be completely useless if it's left this way. Why not just put a "this rune does not work for hot Ionian dancers" exception instead

replies.body:
Even Yasuo doesn't typically pick it: http://na.op.gg/champion/yasuo/statistics/top

The only champion that it's OP on is the one that has dashes to champions with multiple resets (aka new Irelia)

TBH, Yasuo players don't use anything unless some streamer shows them to do so.

Like, srsly, how long did it take them to try FH before Frozen Force Yasuo was meta.

Kat. Kled. Lee Sin. Kha Zix. Rengar. Talon. Zed. Evelynn.

All these champions reliably proc it whenever they want to deal damage.

On the flip side, Cheap Shot is much more niche and yet is tuned to be weaker than Sudden Impact...

> [{quoted}](name=Azorlebleu,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GVfbTlnl,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-03-22T16:36:51.164+0000)
>
> There were a lot of others champions that used it almost 100% of the time as well
> {{champion:55}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:157}} 
> and honestly this rune was strong as fck

So what?!!!!
Assassins lost alot of leth in the runes change and it was the only thing we would like to use to improve our damage against squishy that rush the {{item:3047}}

My point is that the rune wasn't nerfed exclusively for Irelia, as the OP says it.
And yeah this rune is too strong, especially early game. Put power somewhere else in the Domination Tree if you really want to buff assassins, but this rune needs to be tuned down. (play a game with it, and check how much damage it dealt compared to elecrocute)

> [{quoted}](name=Azorlebleu,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GVfbTlnl,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-22T16:42:47.716+0000)
>
> My point is that the rune wasn't nerfed exclusively for Irelia, as the OP says it.
> And yeah this rune is too strong, especially early game. Put power somewhere else in the Domination Tree if you really want to buff assassins, but this rune needs to be tuned down. (play a game with it, and check how much damage it dealt compared to elecrocute)

This rune change will make it useless, not turned down. Especially if they don't add an indicator, as it's considered to be 'perma' atm, and this isn't even true at all and it needs an indicator already, especially for {{champion:55}}. You jump in and EWQEE, this is normally within 5 seconds, and so if you don't purposefully delay the combo in the first place, your sudden impact falls off and you don't reproc it and you're left with Shunpo/w/Q on cooldown anyway. It's a challenge to even keep it running, and is not ideal for your Shunpos to be spaced 5s apart. You can very easily in live now Shunpo, and try to engage 4s later(improperly timed) and miss the proc all together for the rest of your combo(WGR).

I would rather prefer a rune that just gives 5pen(adaptive, why not), at all times.

Currently, the rune lasts longer than it has CD. 
As a Kat main myself, I just notice that this rune is doing almost 3/4 of the electrocute damage in every game, and I think this is defnitely too strong.
However making it have a 25s cooldown would make it hard for Kat to use it purposefully given how often she has to use E in lane, and not especially to trade with her laner. 
Having an indicator would help that's for sure, but 25s is way too long anyways.
They could also make it proc whenever someoen dashes AND hits an ennemy champion, to make it procable on demand instead of randomly losing the buff.

> [{quoted}](name=Azorlebleu,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GVfbTlnl,comment-id=00000000000000010000,timestamp=2018-03-23T13:46:42.650+0000)
>

> As a Kat main myself, I just notice that this rune is doing almost 3/4 of the electrocute damage in every game, and I think this is defnitely too strong.
> However making it have a 25s cooldown would make it hard for Kat to use it purposefully given how often she has to use E in lane, and not especially to trade with her laner. 
> Having an indicator would help that's for sure, but 25s is way too long anyways.
> They could also make it proc whenever someoen dashes AND hits an ennemy champion, to make it procable on demand instead of randomly losing the buff.

Personally, the rune shouldn't have a cooldown at all, until it has an indicator.

Even with it's 4s live cooldown, you miss using it obliviously all the time, and with a 25s cooldown, it's rather important if you know if it's up or not. This change absolutely makes it useless until 1. Indicator or 2. not happen. Katarina combo does not synergize in the slightest with these values on live. You just have the closest refreshed dash to them, thus high power. For example Fiddlesticks doesn't even consider this change for his Ultimates. Nerfing the CDR of Sudden pretty much effects Katarina more than even new Irelia and shes at 50% winrate.  25s is insanely long, karthus flash for R is more important than katarina shunpo with that much cooldown.
It's really good on {{champion:28}} too, although, the added cd probably won't hurt that much.
Only Katarina takes it regularly and she was already nerfed a bunch of times for synergizing well with the new runes.

Yet they chose to nerf her and not the runes, and now they are nerfing the runes too. And you can bet your ass they won’t give her any compensation back. Guess my main will be in the gutter for a while like they do to a lot of champs. Really wish they would’ve been smart enough to realize it was the runes from the beginning.

She doesn't need compensations. At least not in the current state of the game. It amazes me how Kat OTP's keep saying that she's gutted even though people are still able to pull her off.
BUT what they should do is change Sudden impact's cooldown to be 15s from 25s.

It’s literally not just sudden impact. They’ve nerfed both triumph and coup de grace in the percision tree as well as making it so opting into percision secondary gives you less adaptive AD and AP and gives you some attack speed instead which she doesn’t want. They’ve nerfed her CD on shunpo early and gutted it’s damage so she can hardly make plays during the laning phase anymore. Any halfway decent player will be able to harrass and zone out Kat during the laning phase and she’s forced to opt into resolve just to come out even from laning. Her dagger damage late game got nerfed so her already bad late game got worse. Due to her now weaker early she can’t perform mid game when she should shine and then late game is hopeless. All of this together and now the nerf to sudden impact will leave her in a pretty bad spot.

Just because YOU are not able to pull off Kat doesn't mean she's bad buddy.
Precision secondary was a noob trap anyways, other trees provide better utility for her since she doesn't need more damage. You seem to overuse the word "gutted" without actually knowing what it means. 15 less damage on Shunpo doesn't "gut" her and the nerf to her CD was justified.
Any decent Katarina will also know how to survive the lane and look for openings not just in lane but on the map as well. Her lane did not change in the past few patches, the champions that people play in mid did. And most of the time i don't even run Resolve unless the matchup is really nasty. Inspiration gives me nice utility which i can transfer later in mid game. She was already overkilling people late game so realistically she didn't really lose any damage with the last nerf.
Also, let me correct your statement: Due to her not being a god tier pick anymore we Platinum and below players are unable to pilot the champion so it must be weak.
She IS weaker and i do agree to that but not to the length you people do. The thing is that currently champions that screw Katarina over early are picked so there's not a problem with the champion itself. Even so, she's still able to transition into her mid game powerspike and carry games if YOU are able to pull her off. Katarina will never really be in a bad spot, especially under D3 where she's always gonna be considered broken.

Ah the Katarina community. As soon as their champ gets touched or isn't S tier they start crying. Even though their incompetence is the only reason for them not climbing. Legit one of the worst communities in this game.

No, just no. Percision was not a noob trap. That was by far her best secondary tree. Triumph and Coup de Grace synergize so well with her kit. In terms of her shunpo damage, yea 15 less damage is a lot when it’s base damage at level 1 use to be 30. That’s HALF the damage at level 1. I said “they gutted the damage” not “the change gutted her”. Don’t put words in my mouth kid. I do agree the shunpo nerfs were justified at the time, but with the recent reverts to rengar and Leblanc both of them have gotten their kill times shortened again.  Now Kat is left with a longer burst window which is easily outplayed in all stages of the game.

Do us all a favor and don’t post on the boards or respond if you can’t keep your ego and your attitude in check. Name calling and rank shaming is pretty shallow and I won’t waste my time trying to have a discussion with you if you can’t have a civil discussion without inflating your ego and degrading other people. You sitting here on your high horse calling the Katarina players one of the worst communities in the game, well you sound like a pretty big reason why. I feel bad for anyone who has to deal with you in game.

Inspiration was always a better choice since it gave you a stopwatch plus free boots at the time. And the gold advantages that you get from them are far superior than a bit more damage from precision. The same reason why Klepto was and is still good.
Katarina's kit works better than the stated champions which is why longer burst windows are allowed and needed.

And LOL at the ego part. How is that rank shaming? Those are literal facts. Low elo is unable to pilot her and complains instead. I think you're the one with an ego since you're failing to realize that the champions isn't what's bad. Not sure what you think any challenger player or coach would tell you instead.
wasn't the nerf on triumph just you get 5 gold less on kills? or am i thinking too far back
What's the problem? Only a few champions actually have so much mobility to proc it repeatedly.

So because it's only useful on a handful of champions, might as well go all the way and make it useless for everyone? 

I'd understand if they also increased the lethality/mpen to 30-40 as well.

Dude. This isn't going to make it useless on anyone.

It's *equalizing the impact of it*. Meaning now {{champion:84}} and {{champion:238}} get the same number of procs on it.

It will be a minor nerf to champions who blinked/jumped around a lot *and* ran the rune, such as Katarina, since it won't be up for every trade (effective 1s cooldown on live, since it's up for 4 seconds and has a 5 second cooldown. That's basically no cooldown). This has the double benefit of power being able to be shifted from the rune to the champion as needed, and with the rune being able to be balanced in a way that it doesn't ruin the champions running it.

Basically: This will only be a nerf to the champions that *can* (**and** do) blink every 5-10 seconds. Katarina, Akali, Irelia, Fiora...*Those* are the ones affected by it. Not the ones who only use it rarely, or at the start of the fight, like Aatrox, Zed, Evelynn, or Azir. It's a nerf to abuse cases. Meaning it can be made good on people who don't abuse it.
This. Especially since assassins mainly care about the first 4 seconds of fights they're in anyway.

But you can't control when it gets consumed. The champs who dash a lot actually won't be able to use it at all because its going to be on cooldown when they need it. It will only be useful on a much smaller pool than before - the ones who only dash when they are actually fighting and never otherwise.
{{champion:91}} will put it on cooldown just going on his way to a gank.
meanwhile camille, illaoi, irelia, ahri(with a kiting playstyle), and other low burst champions can barely use it now

Camille has two dashes, both are for right into combat. No direct effect on her, although it *will* force her to spread out her trades more.

Illaoi has one "dash". But she shouldn't have the rune, anyways.

Irelia would be one such person nerfed by it. Which is probably good, given the fucking massive number of dashes she'll have.

Ahri doesn't need it. She has three dashes, but all are executed within 10 seconds of one-another. And she typically uses two within the first 4 seconds. She might be down *a* proc of it in a fight. But, the thing is: She uses her combo, and her combo isn't back up in time before her ult is expired. So this has no immediate impact on her.

And all the champions that don't have a dash every 8 seconds? Well, they'll get stronger. Because it'll probably be buffed to be stronger, but on a lower cooldown.

Yeah about Illaoi and Camille I do mean for laning phase where it's very helpful for trades. I'd be fine if it were 10s or 15s maybe but 25 is very long in that it only becomes efficient (since you can use your dashes for a lot of things before then) in the late game where assassins roam looking for picks.

It's not meta but for top lane domination is seriously underrated especially since ghost poro makes it harder to gank.
irelia isn't the only one who abuses this rune lol

so Assassins get nerfed again because of something else abusing their stuff?

honestly go fuck yourself Riot.

I dare guess that the champions that riot viewed as "problematic" users for duskblade were the ones they chose to buff as they nerfed the item, meaning Graves,Kayn,Kha'Zix,Miss Fortune,Nocturne,Rengar,Shaco,Talon,Wukong and Zed.


Some more might get help but those ought to be the main offenders as riot saw the need to buff them in order to nerf duskblade without causing a shitstorm.


But on the positive side, if the items and runes get nerfed the assassins can get individual buffs to their own stats and scalings, that cant be taken by anyone else.

if you ask me, half of these compensation buffs don't even make up for the loss of basically half the damage on {{item:3147}}.
That item was pretty much deleted.

I wonder why Duskblade had to be the first item to be nerfed.
Assassins definitely aren't the class that's causing only problems atm in the first place.

Bot lane is still broken, Junglers can still gank every lane 10 times a minute without losing anything, {{champion:50}} is still in his overbuffed state, {{champion:19}} is still on his 55% wr, {{champion:40}} and {{champion:34}} are for some reason allowed to still be broken for months now, but better gut Duskblade first I guess.

The only champ that actually was a problem was {{champion:121}}.
And I'm pretty sure it will take months for now until Riot actually starts fixing the real problems in this game.

Janna isnt so much broken as her entire kit is too good for doing it's job so to write, she is too good at protecting even when her numbers get cut, time and time again.

Anivia isn't so bad? I mean sure she is reliable but she is also very clear cut with clear weaknesses, when i play her i never feel like i did with malz that my opponent could never have done anything to stop me from doing whatever i wanted for any but the worst matchups.

She even fell down for quite some time until the changes to mage items went through, and she is indeed one of the mages who benefited the most from said changes to {{item:3040}}&{{item:3151}} which has served to bring her back in top shape.

If i had to describe it it´d be like that before she was OP on her own but now like say kha6 just did she abuses items to go outa control and be a bit stronger.

What do you find so bad about her? O_O

WW ......can't say i know for sure but he isn't nearly as popular in korea last i checked and heard, so i assume its a problem of how we play rather than him being OP.

{{champion:34}} simply does the things she does way too good.

Her damage is way too high and reliable, she has easy waveclear, but the worst part:
She gets a better GA on only a 4 minute CD.

That egg combined with her waveclear helps her to survive the lane phase easily if you don't fuck up completely or get camped, and once you got some items and levels, the egg even gets Armor and MR instead of losing it, which makes it even more busted.

It simply has a waay to low CD for the amount of power it has.
It's way too hard to kill in a fight if you aren't able to completely isolate her away from your enemies.

If you are not a coordinated team, that is already hard enough.

Combine that with her E that also has almost no CD and deals damage that isn't legit (It's not even a challenge to get the bonus damage off it), and you have a champion that has a rather simple, but still broken kit.

Either her damage or her safety has to go.
No mage that can pull off such damage should have a free ga.

That champ is my current ban atm simply because of these things.

Her damage is not anywhere near reliable? O_O

It needs you eat her Q and remain in her ulti area.......optimally for her part she´d start her ulti right ontop of you and Q to keep you inside it while using E whenever possible.

She is truly miserable against those with either the ability avoid her Q or just more range than her.

Egg is great to prevent yourself being assassinated.....when you are under tower or have help nearby, i have played as and against Anivia and i dont struggle so much with it......although i mainly play champs like Syndra or Ahri if i see Anivia being the deal.

And ironically, the worst game i ever had playing Anivia was against Syndra, i literally could not go near minions without getting chunked for all my health no matter how i tried, and the one time my jungler came to help.....said jungler exploded.

But champs like Kata,kassadin and Ekko can truly make Anivia miserable......and heaven forbid you play against Fizz, i still have no idea how to deal with him just ulting on my slow ass and then diving in.

And i could not find anything on her gaining armor while in egg form, rather, she just keeps whatever stats she already has.....which still makes her a very fragile ice bird most of the time.

The egg not really OP when put on a champ that dies in a few hits from any attacker that can actually get her into it in the first place, and that is how getting caught in the midgame usually ends with her.....and while remaining safe from suddenly exploding and instantly dying is nice i can't help but feel that its not so bad.

Even Koreans only ban her in about 7% of their games in plati+, and her winrate remains at ~51,5%


Her E bonus damage needs you to either eat her slow ass Q or stand inside her ulti......you might as well go and let cassio shot you for free......heck that ulti even cancels from any form of hard CC.



Really, Anivia is a great champ when you have a really solid team and frontline, she relies entirely on her opponents not being able to get out of her ultimate, if they can or if they have the ability to force her to reposition from a distance then her damage gets cut drastically.

And to mention but games often end rather quickly these days, Anivia who doesn't really get going until 3-4 items isn't really a powerhouse until that point.

What does make her so good is the fact that she unlike many others can afford to just farm and let time pass while scaling, others like Syndra, ahri or TF don't have the same luxury of time.

......Well that and Anivia is hopelessly bad at roaming since she is so slow and her wall doesnt really get very wide until a very late stage...so just farming is her only strategy if she cant cheekily kill the opponent.

Roam around and crush the map and she will be quite depressed.

Her damage is reliable because she can just Ult and E while keeping the enemies in the Zone with her W.
It's delayed, but it's pretty reliable if you can pull it off in the right moment.

She might not be able to take the offensive, but she doesn't have to, she scales.
It's the enemy that is forced to make a move.
And one wrong step from the enemy and you can easily get your combo on him.

It's hard to outrange her because her W range is just way to high, and Assassins usually have problems killing her either on lane against her egg and damage. She can just play safe all day. Pretty much only Lux and Xerath really outrange her, of which the latter is also broken atm, I play him pretty often and he is good to rival Anivia.

Like you said, the only way to actually do anything against her is to outrotate her early and bring your team ahead before she scales.
But if that doesn't work, gg. And even then finding moments to rotate against her waveclear isn't an easy thing to do in the first place.

Also, her winrate is somewhere around 53-54% for months now across mid and high elo, which definitely isn't fine for a mage. Idk where you got 51,5% from.

In theory getting out her egg and killing her sound easy, but in reality that isn't so easy, at least not in SoloQ.
To kill her you have to put in so much more work than to kill any other mage, and it feels like she doesn't even pay anything for that, considering her scaling and damage.

> Her damage is reliable because she can just Ult and E while keeping the enemies in the Zone with her W.
> It's delayed, but it's pretty reliable if you can pull it off in the right moment.

If she actually walks up like this, what prevents her opponent from just shooting back and chuncking her? And any hard CC will literally cancel her ultimate before the E even hits if timed right.

E also doesnt get max damage unless ulti has ramped up to max first.

> She might not be able to take the offensive, but she doesn't have to, she scales.
> It's the enemy that is forced to make a move.
> And one wrong step from the enemy and you can easily get your combo on him.

This also means that Anivia cant take the initiative, if enemy team splits, flanks or just have zone control of their own then it really gets difficult for her.

The worst part for her is being unable to influence lanes for so long, enemy team can easily get a unstoppable lead in the duration while she still sits and tries to get her second item, by the time she gets her third then can take their lead and get baron.

She wont have the ability to do anything after that. 


> It's hard to outrange her because her W range is just way to high, and Assassins usually have problems killing her either on lane against her egg and damage. She can just play safe all day. Pretty much only Lux and Xerath really outrange her, of which the latter is also broken atm, I play him pretty often and he is good to rival Anivia.

You dont need to outrange her, all you need is to be able to cancel her ultimate and/or dodge her Q, which is why i like both Ahri and Syndra into that matchup,.,,,,at least when Syndra isnt bugged. 

Problems killing her? In lane its really easy for most of them, the reason they lose eventually is that it's hard to do in teamfights and her DPS is top class thanks to liandry buffs. 

Well that and she actually scales well, but she is a zone control mage so by default, avoid playing into her hands and she cant really do much. 


> Like you said, the only way to actually do anything against her is to outrotate her early and bring your team ahead before she scales.

Thats the price she pays for safety though, being unable to really impact the map, and you can beat her in lane if you play right or have the right cards on hand. 


> But if that doesn't work, gg. And even then finding moments to rotate against her waveclear isn't an easy thing to do in the first place.

Split your team then, she cant be everywhere, nor can she actually do much if she gets flanked.....she is actually one of the weakest mages when it comes to responding to an attack when she has already dropped her ulti elsewhere. 

> Also, her winrate is somewhere around 53-54% for months now across mid and high elo, which definitely isn't fine for a mage. Idk where you got 51,5% from.

Even OP.GG, which puts her at her highest being 52%, and looking at her winrate it has in fact been slowly sinking since patch 8,2, a patch in which she had rapidly risen, but her playrate hasnt ever been really high either so it's not a case of 40% pickrate and 52% winrate. 

With only 6-7% playrate it's not really unreasonable to have 52% winrate on a fairly easy but reliable champ. 

> In theory getting out her egg and killing her sound easy, but in reality that isn't so easy, at least not in SoloQ.

It is easy.........as long as you arent playing something thats weak early or lack the ability to really get ontop of her and finish her like say Lissandra. 

> To kill her you have to put in so much more work than to kill any other mage, and it feels like she doesn't even pay anything for that, considering her scaling and damage.

Her damage is as i mentioned, super conditional, she needs to land her Q, make you stand in her ultimate and she also needs to not be hit by CC.

She cant fight while moving, she cant handle mobilty or flankers and she cant handle range, she is also very slow so she struggles to reposition. 

I honestly think that the only reason she does well at this time is because of the changes to seraph and liandry being greatly beneficial for her.
its really hard kill anivia due u have to kill her 2 times, and lets be real midlaners doesnt have dps enough to kill her egg.

For most ideal users of the rune, it's not designed to be used every 6 seconds. It's designed to give a substantial amount of lethality on your dash as an assassin. Other champions with really repeatable dashes abused the rune.
I think a way of compensating it without breaking it would be to give the lethality/mpen scaling ratios so it won't feel completely useless late game since it won't be available as often
